--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "stack@..." <stack@...> wrote:

> T=
he way the submit-new-job works when you go via JMX is that upon 
> submiss=
ion, the job jar is unbundled and then a new job is created that 
> is base=
d on the unbundled jar.  A quick look at the code shows no
reason 
> why th=
is type of recover should not work (Start here: 
> http://crawler.archive.o=
rg/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html#1165).
> 
> If you look at the or=
der file in the UI, does it show 'recover-path' 
> pointing to the right pl=
ace (or is it empty)?  Does the recover.gz 
> pointed to for sure exist?  A=
nything in heritrix_out.log?
> 
> Any particular reason for your favoring t=
he old style recover.gz log 
> over checkpointing?
> St.Ack
> 

I just got =
back to this issue recently I and noticed I was not
including the settings =
folder into the job jar. Actually I didn't know
I could do it just until I =
saw this:
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html=
#1374

Anyway, someone might bump into this issue and I wanted to make sure=

the problem was solved. The script works fine.

My reason for choosing rec=
over.gz log over checkpointing is that Im
able to revisit all the seeds eve=
n after the crawl has finished. They
were meant for similar purposes but I =
guess they work differently 

Samuel
